cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi NNE of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the Florida Keys Monday, then over the eastern Gulf aiming for the central Gulf Coast near the Mississippi/Alabama coastline late Tuesday night into Wednesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near the Mississippi–Alabama border (close to Mobile Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama-Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, Louisiana, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire central Gulf Coast from the Florida Panhandle through Louisiana, including the Alabama coast and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (gusts 40‒50 mph) possible Tuesday night into Wednesday at Mobile and Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2‒4 ft surge in and around Mobile Bay, especially with onshore flow near landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall 2‒4 inches with locally higher totals exceeding 4 inches, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous rip currents; isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands.
